result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Dampeer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. First 4 months straight time, the remainder can be served with Huber release.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
Provide a DNA sample.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: 5 MONTHS condition time at the day reporting center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig Dampeer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  First 4 months straight time, the remainder can be served with Huber release.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 5 MONTHS condition time at the day reporting center.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Filed:     
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Craig Dampeer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Craig Dampeer in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing, however parties would like to proceed with a plea and sentencing hearing instead.    Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Craig Dampeer in court with Attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Craig Dampeer in custody.  
David John Behm for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Defense not prepared to proceed to plea hearing on today.  Defense filed notice of motion; hearing date selected.  The court allows the state until 8-05-15 to file response.  Parties advised effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence, received and filed.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Craig Dampeer not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail $500.00.   Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with drug testing, absolute sobriety, no use or possession of controlled substances, no firearms/dangerous weapons.

Defendant Craig Dampeer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Craig Dampeer in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Original Information previsouly filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted defense request.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing May 27, 2015 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:
Unknown

Defendant Craig Dampeer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Zachary Wittchow for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF447 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state:William Savagian-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense Counsel requests an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/26/15.
css

Defendant Craig Dampeer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Hanna Kolberg for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs the Court that the officer is not available to appear for today's proceedings.  Defense Counsel would ask the Court to consider a dismissal if the State is not prepared to commence the hearing on the next scheduled court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Supplemental Order setting Forth Conditions of Defendant's Release, for no drugs, no drug paraphernalia or no weapons, signed and filed.

Defendant Craig Dampeer in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Defendant Craig Dampeer in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
